meanings.sent1: The rainbow had an arcuate appearance in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The bridge had an arcuate design, curving gracefully over the river.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to fit into the arcuate opening of the box, but it was too small.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an arcuate crescent moon in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The arcuate path of the river meandered through the valley, creating a beautiful landscape.

meanings.sent1: The arcuate doorway led into the ancient castle.
meanings.sent2: The tree branches grew in an arcuate fashion, creating a natural canopy.
meanings.sent3: The chef created an arcuate tower of pancakes for breakfast.
meanings.sent4: The rainbow formed an arcuate bridge between the two hills.
meanings.sent5: The arcuate pattern on the ceiling resembled the ribs of a giant umbrella.

meanings.definition: Having a curved or arched structure.
meanings.sent1: The arcuate spine of the dinosaur fossil was carefully preserved.
meanings.sent2: The arcuate windows of the old church let in soft, filtered light.
meanings.sent3: The arcuate handle of the umbrella made it easy to carry in the rain.
meanings.sent4: The arcuate petals of the flower opened up to reveal a hidden center.
meanings.sent5: The arcuate roof of the gazebo provided shelter from the sun on hot days.
